%%% auto-generated from TBIL checkit bank

\section{Learning target DF3, version 3}
\providecommand{\stxKnowl}{}\renewcommand{\stxKnowl}[1]{#1}
\providecommand{\stxOuttro}{}\renewcommand{\stxOuttro}[1]{#1}
\providecommand{\stxTitle}{}\renewcommand{\stxTitle}[1]{#1}
% Comment next line to show outtros
\renewcommand{\stxOuttro}[1]{}
%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
\stxKnowl{
 Demonstrate and explain how to find the derivative of the following functions. Be sure to write down which derivative rules (constant multiple, sum/difference, etc.) you are using in your work.

\begin{enumerate}
\item
\stxKnowl{
 \(h(x) = 9 \, x^{5} - x^{4} - x^{3} - 6\) 

\stxOuttro{
 \(h'(x) = 45 \, x^{4} - 4 \, x^{3} - 3 \, x^{2}\) 

}
}
\vfill
\item
\stxKnowl{
 \(f(y) = -2 \, e^{y} - 4 \, \sin\left(y\right)\) 

\stxOuttro{
 \(f'(y) = -4 \, \cos\left(y\right) - 2 \, e^{y}\) 

}
}
\vfill
\item
\stxKnowl{
 \(g(t) = \sqrt[3]{t^7} + \frac{2}{t^{2}}\) 

\stxOuttro{
 \(g'(t) = \frac{7}{3} \, t^{\frac{4}{3}} - \frac{4}{t^{3}}\) 

}
}
\vfill
\end{enumerate}
}

\section{Learning target DF4, version 3}
\providecommand{\stxKnowl}{}\renewcommand{\stxKnowl}[1]{#1}
\providecommand{\stxOuttro}{}\renewcommand{\stxOuttro}[1]{#1}
\providecommand{\stxTitle}{}\renewcommand{\stxTitle}[1]{#1}
% Comment next line to show outtros
\renewcommand{\stxOuttro}[1]{}
%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
\stxKnowl{
 Demonstrate and explain how to find the derivative of the following functions. Be sure to write down which derivative rules (product, quotient, sum and difference, etc.) you are using.

\begin{enumerate}
\item
\stxKnowl{
\(\renewcommand{\log}{\ln} g(w)= -\frac{2 \, w^{2} + 6 \, w + 1}{w^{\frac{1}{5}}}\)

\stxOuttro{
\(\renewcommand{\log}{\ln} g' (w)= -\frac{18 \, w^{2} + 24 \, w - 1}{5 \, w^{\frac{6}{5}}}\)

}
}
\vfill
\item
\stxKnowl{
\(\renewcommand{\log}{\ln} f(w)= -\frac{\sin\left(w\right)}{3 \, w^{2} - 3 \, w + 4}\)

\stxOuttro{
\(\renewcommand{\log}{\ln} f' (w)= -\frac{\cos\left(w\right)}{3 \, w^{2} - 3 \, w + 4} + \frac{3 \, {\left(2 \, w - 1\right)} \sin\left(w\right)}{{\left(3 \, w^{2} - 3 \, w + 4\right)}^{2}}\)

}
}
\vfill
\item
\stxKnowl{
\(\renewcommand{\log}{\ln} h(w)= -{\left(2 \, w^{2} + 5 \, w - 5\right)} e^{w}\)

\stxOuttro{
\(\renewcommand{\log}{\ln} h' (w)= -{\left(2 \, w^{2} + 5 \, w - 5\right)} e^{w} - {\left(4 \, w + 5\right)} e^{w}\)

}
}
\vfill
\end{enumerate}
}

%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%

\section{Learning target DF5, version 3}
\providecommand{\stxKnowl}{}\renewcommand{\stxKnowl}[1]{#1}
\providecommand{\stxOuttro}{}\renewcommand{\stxOuttro}[1]{#1}
\providecommand{\stxTitle}{}\renewcommand{\stxTitle}[1]{#1}
% Comment next line to show outtros
\renewcommand{\stxOuttro}[1]{}
%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
\stxKnowl{
 Demonstrate and explain how to find the derivative of the following functions. Be sure to write down which derivative rules (constant multiple, sum, chain, etc.) you are using.

\begin{enumerate}
\item
\stxKnowl{
\(k(w)= -{\left(5 \, w + 2 \, e^{w} + 1\right)}^{3}\)

\stxOuttro{
\(k' (w)= -3 \, {\left(5 \, w + 2 \, e^{w} + 1\right)}^{2} {\left(2 \, e^{w} + 5\right)}\)

}
}
\vfill
\item
\stxKnowl{
\(g(y)= 3 \, \sin\left(y^{2/5}\right)\)

\stxOuttro{
\(g' (y)= \frac{6 \, \cos\left(y^{\frac{2}{5}}\right)}{5 \, y^{\frac{3}{5}}}\)

}
}
\vfill
\item
\stxKnowl{
\(h(x)= 6 \, \cos\left(-5 \, x^{2} - x + 4\right)\)

\stxOuttro{
\(h' (x)= 6 \, {\left(10 \, x + 1\right)} \sin\left(-5 \, x^{2} - x + 4\right)\)

}
}
\vfill
\item
\stxKnowl{
\(f(t)= 3 \, \Big(\sin\left(t\right)\Big)^{2/5}\)

\stxOuttro{
\(f' (t)= \frac{6 \, \cos\left(t\right)}{5 \, \sin\left(t\right)^{\frac{3}{5}}}\)

}
}
\vfill
\end{enumerate}
}

\section{Learning target DF6, version 3}
\providecommand{\stxKnowl}{}\renewcommand{\stxKnowl}[1]{#1}
\providecommand{\stxOuttro}{}\renewcommand{\stxOuttro}[1]{#1}
\providecommand{\stxTitle}{}\renewcommand{\stxTitle}[1]{#1}
% Comment next line to show outtros
\renewcommand{\stxOuttro}[1]{}
%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
\stxKnowl{
 Demonstrate and explain how to find the derivative of the following functions. Be sure to write down which derivative rules (constant multiple, sum and difference, etc.) you are using.

\begin{enumerate}
\item
\stxKnowl{
\(f(t) = \sqrt{\cos\left(-t^{4} - 6\right)}\)

\stxOuttro{
\(f ' (t) = \frac{2 \, t^{3} \sin\left(-t^{4} - 6\right)}{\sqrt{\cos\left(-t^{4} - 6\right)}}\)

}
}
\vfill
\item
\stxKnowl{
\(h(x) = \left( \frac{5 \, x^{5} - 2}{3 \, {\left(x^{3} - 1\right)}} \right)^{ 4 }\)

\stxOuttro{
\(h ' (x) = 4 \left( \frac{5 \, x^{5} - 2}{3 \, {\left(x^{3} - 1\right)}} \right)^{ 3 } \left( \frac{25 \, x^{4}}{3 \, {\left(x^{3} - 1\right)}} - \frac{{\left(5 \, x^{5} - 2\right)} x^{2}}{{\left(x^{3} - 1\right)}^{2}} \right)\)

}
}
\vfill
\item
\stxKnowl{
\(g(w) = {\left(3 \, w^{3} + 2 \, w^{2}\right)}^{3} w^{\frac{1}{3}}\)

\stxOuttro{
\(g ' (w) = 3 \, {\left(3 \, w^{3} + 2 \, w^{2}\right)}^{2} {\left(9 \, w^{2} + 4 \, w\right)} w^{\frac{1}{3}} + \frac{{\left(3 \, w^{3} + 2 \, w^{2}\right)}^{3}}{3 \, w^{\frac{2}{3}}}\)

}
}
\vfill
\end{enumerate}
}

\section{Learning target DF7, version 3}
\providecommand{\stxKnowl}{}\renewcommand{\stxKnowl}[1]{#1}
\providecommand{\stxOuttro}{}\renewcommand{\stxOuttro}[1]{#1}
\providecommand{\stxTitle}{}\renewcommand{\stxTitle}[1]{#1}
% Comment next line to show outtros
\renewcommand{\stxOuttro}[1]{}
%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
\stxKnowl{
Use implicit differentiation to find \(\frac{dy}{dx}\), aka \(y'\), for the equations below.
\begin{enumerate}
\item
\stxKnowl{
\(x^5 - 8\, y^4 = \sin\left(y\right) - 7\)

\stxOuttro{
\(\frac{dy}{dx}=-\frac{-5 \, x^{4}}{32 \, y^{3} + \cos\left(y\right)}\)

}
}
\vfill
\item
\stxKnowl{
\(-5 \, y\, \cos\left(x\right) + 3 \, e^{x} = 0\)

\stxOuttro{
\(\frac{dy}{dx}=\frac{5 \, y \sin\left(x\right) + 3 \, e^{x}}{5 \, \cos\left(x\right)}\)

}
}
\vfill
\end{enumerate}
}
